attributes.action: Make mental health resilience and mental illness teaching mandatory in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Mental illness is happening to you; it’s not your fault.
attributes.background: Work with experts ie- professional psychiatrists and teachers to implement an affective curriculum for pupils so they develop into resilient, secure, and healthy individuals who can reach their full potential without being systemically disadvantaged by their poor mental health and lack of support.

rejection.details:
Mental health is already part of the statutory curriculum. You can read more here

https://www.gov.uk/guidance/teaching-about-mental-wellbeing

We could accept a petition calling for specific changes to the curriculum, or you might like to sign this petition calling for mental health to be a specific subject:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617834
